016
017package org.parboiled.parserunners;
018
019import org.parboiled.Context;
020import org.parboiled.MatchHandler;
021import org.parboiled.MatcherContext;
022import org.parboiled.Rule;
023import org.parboiled.buffers.InputBuffer;
024import org.parboiled.common.*;
025import org.parboiled.matchers.Matcher;
026import org.parboiled.support.MatcherPath;
027import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
028import org.parboiled.support.Position;
029
030import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
031
032/**
033 * A {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.ParseRunner} implementation used for debugging purposes.
034 * It exhibits the same behavior as the {@link ReportingParseRunner} but collects debugging information as to which
035 * rules did match and which didn't.
036 */
037public class TracingParseRunner<V> extends ReportingParseRunner<V> implements MatchHandler {
038    private Predicate<Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>> filter;
039    private Sink<String> log;
040    private MatcherPath lastPath;
041    private int line;
042
043    /**
044     * Creates a new TracingParseRunner instance without filter and a console log for the given rule.
045     *
046     * @param rule the parser rule
047     */
048    public TracingParseRunner(Rule rule) {
049        super(rule);
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Attaches the given filter to this TracingParseRunner instance.
054     * The given filter is used to select the matchers to print tracing statements for.
055     * NOTE: The given filter must be of type {@literal Predicate<Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>>}. The reason this type is not
056     * directly specified in the constructors signature is that this would make predicate expressions using the
057     * {@link Predicates} operations and the predefined predicate constructors in {@link org.parboiled.support.Filters}
058     * much more cumbersome to write (due to Java limited type parameters inference logic you would have to explicitly
059     * state the type parameters in many places).
060     *
061     * @param filter the matcher filter selecting the matchers to print tracing statements for. Must be of type
062     *               {@literal Predicate<Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>>}.
063     * @return this instance
064     */
065    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked"})
066    public TracingParseRunner<V> withFilter(Predicate<?> filter) {
067        this.filter = (Predicate<Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>>) checkArgNotNull(filter, "filter");
068        return this;
069    }
070
071    public Predicate<Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>> getFilter() {
072        if (filter == null) {
073            withFilter(Predicates.alwaysTrue());
074        }
075        return filter;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Attaches the given log to this TracingParseRunner instance.
080     *
081     * @param log the log to use
082     * @return this instance
083     */
084    public TracingParseRunner<V> withLog(Sink<String> log) {
085        this.log = log;
086        return this;
087    }
088
089    public Sink<String> getLog() {
090        if (log == null) {
091            withLog(new ConsoleSink());
092        }
093        return log;
094    }
095
096    @Override
097    protected ParsingResult<V> runBasicMatch(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
098        getLog().receive("Starting new parsing run\n");
099        lastPath = null;
100
101        MatcherContext<V> rootContext = createRootContext(inputBuffer, this, true);
102        boolean matched = rootContext.runMatcher();
103        return createParsingResult(matched, rootContext);
104    }
105
106    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked"})
107    public boolean match(MatcherContext<?> context) {
108        Matcher matcher = context.getMatcher();
109        boolean matched = matcher.match(context);
110        if (getFilter().apply(new Tuple2<Context<?>, Boolean>(context, matched))) {
111            line++;
112            print(context, matched); // set line-dependent breakpoint here
113        }
114        return matched;
115    }
116
117    private void print(MatcherContext<?> context, boolean matched) {
118        Position pos = context.getInputBuffer().getPosition(context.getCurrentIndex());
119        MatcherPath path = context.getPath();
120        MatcherPath prefix = lastPath != null ? path.commonPrefix(lastPath) : null;
121        if (prefix != null && prefix.length() > 1) getLog().receive("..(" + (prefix.length() - 1) + ")../");
122        getLog().receive(path.toString(prefix != null ? prefix.parent : null));
123        String line = context.getInputBuffer().extractLine(pos.line);
124        getLog().receive(", " + (matched ? "matched" : "failed") + ", cursor at " + pos.line + ':' + pos.column +
125                " after \"" + line.substring(0, Math.min(line.length(), pos.column - 1)) + "\"\n");
126        lastPath = path;
127    }
128}
129
